meanings.definition: Not inclined to seek or enjoy the company of others.
meanings.sent1: The cat was unsociable, preferring to nap alone in the sun.
meanings.sent2: She found her unsociable neighbor difficult to approach for a friendly chat.
meanings.sent3: The unsociable cactus refused to join the garden party.
meanings.sent4: The old, unsociable oak tree stood alone in the field, shunning the other trees.
meanings.sent5: The unsociable student always sat by themselves at lunch, avoiding the noisy cafeteria.

meanings.sent1: The unsociable dog growled at anyone who came near its food bowl.
meanings.sent2: His unsociable behavior made it hard for him to make new friends.
meanings.sent3: The unsociable cloud refused to join the group of fluffy clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The unsociable storm raged on, isolating itself from the other weather patterns.
meanings.sent5: The unsociable cat hissed at anyone who tried to pet it, keeping to itself in the corner.

meanings.sent1: The unsociable weather kept everyone indoors, away from the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The unsociable room layout made it hard for people to mingle at the party.
meanings.sent3: The unsociable clock refused to chime when people gathered around it.
meanings.sent4: The unsociable road led through desolate lands, devoid of any signs of life.
meanings.sent5: The unsociable park bench was hidden in a secluded corner, away from the main path.
